_description: Hemoglobin oxygen binding parameters for human red blood cells

_citations.adair_model: Imai K. Allosteric Effects in Haemoglobin. Cambridge University Press, 1982
_citations.adair_constants: Winslow RM et al. The reaction of deoxygenated hemoglobin with carbon monoxide. J Biol Chem. 1977;252:2331-2337
_citations.dpg_effect: Benesch R, Benesch RE. Intracellular organic phosphates as regulators of oxygen release by haemoglobin. Nature. 1969;221(5181):618-622
_citations.bohr_effect: Bohr C, Hasselbalch K, Krogh A. Ueber einen in biologischer Beziehung wichtigen Einfluss. Skand Arch Physiol. 1904;16:402-412
_citations.kinetics: Gibson QH. The kinetics of reactions between haemoglobin and gases. Prog Biophys Mol Biol. 1970;21:1-46
_citations.temperature: Roughton FJW, Severinghaus JW. Accurate determination of O2 dissociation curve of human blood. J Appl Physiol. 1973;35:861-869

_units.kinetic_rates: per second (s⁻¹) or per mM per second (mM⁻¹·s⁻¹)

adair_constants._description: Successive binding constants for 4-site oxygen binding model
adair_constants._citation: Imai 1982, fitted to human HbA at standard conditions
adair_constants._notes: Values increase with each binding (positive cooperativity)

k1_per_mmHg._notes: First O2 binds weakly (T state dominant)

k4_per_mmHg._notes: Fourth O2 binds very strongly (R state)

oec_parameters._description: Oxygen equilibrium curve characteristics at standard conditions

hill_coefficient._notes: Maximum slope of Hill plot, measure of cooperativity

coefficient._notes: ΔlogP50/ΔpH; negative means lower pH → higher P50 (right shift)

bohr_effect._mechanism: H+ binding to His146β and other residues stabilizes T state

dpg_effect._mechanism: 2,3-DPG binds in central cavity of deoxy-Hb, stabilizing T state

temperature_effect._description: Temperature effect on oxygen affinity (van't Hoff)
temperature_effect._mechanism: Higher temperature favors dissociated state (Le Chatelier)

sensitivity_per_mmHg._notes: Additional P50 shift beyond pH-mediated Bohr effect

co2_effect._mechanism: CO2 forms carbamino compounds with N-terminal amino groups

kinetics._description: Oxygen binding and release rate constants

k_on_per_mM_per_sec._notes: Association rate constant for O2 binding

kinetics._notes: These are effective rates; actual rates depend on conformation

hemoglobin_concentration_mM._notes: As tetramer; ~150 g/L or 2.3 mM as monomer

validation_targets._description: Key metrics for model validation against Imai 1982 data
validation_targets._tolerance: Values should be within stated tolerance of target
